Title: Experience and motivation to manage and support data scientists.
jobsnippet2: Share your knowledge and enthusiasm for data science with colleagues; help them to be more data…
Text:
Job detailsHere’s how the job details align with your job preferences. Manage job preferences anytime in your profile.Pay£66,000 a yearJob typeFull-time
 
  
   
    Summary 
   
   
     £66,000* - £90,200* This isn’t the 8-5 or 9-6. This is making a difference every day.
     Last year we established an Analytics function, and now we are looking for a Data Science Team Manager. In this role you will be responsible for delivery of your own projects, plus also the line management of data scientists. Our mission is to support senior management and operational departments by using data science to generate business value. If you are excited to help build something new, with the support of the world’s fourth-largest largest retailer, we’d love to hear from you.
     Lidl GB continues to grow rapidly; we have over 960 stores and we just opened our largest-ever warehouse. The Analytics function is tasked to support the whole business including property, sales, supply chain and logistics, buying, marketing and support functions. Therefore, you should expect to work on diverse projects, using a range of techniques. We work predominantly in Python and have a modern data stack on Azure including Snowflake, Databricks and MLFlow. In addition to machine learning, we expect to be involved in forecasting, optimisation, simulation and geospatial analysis. In all cases the emphasis is on improving decisions and processes to deliver tangible results. There is an established Analytics team at International Head Office in Germany and growing teams in other Lidl countries. Therefore, you will be part of a global support network. In GB, you will be working closely with our Business Intelligence and Management Accounting teams who are co-located in our brand-new office in Southwest London
     We have moved to a hybrid working model with a recommended 2 days in the office per week for appropriate Head Office and Regional roles, empowering our teams to choose how and where they work best. We feel it is important that, where possible, we offer our colleagues as much flexibility as possible and trust our teams to determine the right environments that work most effectively for them.
     As part of your application, you will be asked to complete an Online Assessment developed by members of the Lidl Analytics Community. The assessment is compromised of three key knowledge tests which are focused around Statistics, Machine Learning and Python. If everything goes well, someone from the recruitment team will get in touch to discuss your application over the phone and following this you may be invited to face to face interview.
   
  
  
   
     What you'll do 
   
   
    
     Manage a small team of data scientists. Provide guidance to your team on the day-to-day delivery of projects. Conduct their annual performance management and support their development
      Contribute to the development of the Analytics function: developing stakeholder relationships; establishing processes; sustaining our positive and collaborate culture.
      Own your own data science projects end-to-end: defining requirements, conducting experiments, demonstrating value and supporting implementation\adoption
      Use modern data science techniques for the optimisation of business processes using predictive and prescriptive methods
      Take responsibility for driving high technical standards so that your solutions are appropriate, comprehensible, well-structured and reproducible
      Share your knowledge and enthusiasm for data science with colleagues; help them to be more data-savvy
      Keep up to date with the latest analytics and data science trends and identify opportunities to enhance our methods or tools
      Participate in the global analytics community and the exchange of methods and solutions
      When required, support the development of solutions in cooperation with other countries or the international analytics teams to ensure the rapid dissemination of solutions in the global Lidl analytics community
    
   
  
  
   
     What you'll need 
   
   
    
     Experience and motivation to manage and support data scientists
      Intellectual confidence and open-mindedness to work with your team to find the best solutions.
      Flexible and organised - able to combine management and individual contributor responsibilities.
      Genuine enthusiasm for using data to solve problems.
      Strong experience of applying data science to real-world problems.
      Strong knowledge of machine learning, statistics, optimisation, and data mining methods, especially in Python.
      Strong knowledge of data wrangling and manipulation; a sceptical and quality-oriented approach.
      Degree in data science, operational research, mathematics, statistics, computer science, physics, or a similar subject.
      Strong ability to understand complex problems, and to analyse them in detail.
      Ability to work to tight deadlines and to deliver accurate results.
      Excellent communication skills and ability to work well in a team.
    
   
  
  
   
     What you'll receive 
   
   
    
      This isn't getting by. This is getting what you deserve. Working at Lidl is rewarding, in every sense, because we give you the extensive training to succeed in your role and plenty of opportunities to progress your career here. We're proud to offer a competitive salary from £66,000 up to £90,200* (depending on experience) with 35 days’ holiday per year (pro rata). Save for your future with our pension scheme, or save today with a 10% in store discount, plus extra discounts on days out, cinema tickets and much more.
      
      
     
      includes 10% non-contractual London Weighting allowance
      
      Please note your employment is conditional upon the Company's receipt of satisfactory references and if requested by the Company, a satisfactory Disclosure and Barring Service check.
    
     Disclaimer: due to the high volume of applications we receive, we reserve the right to close a vacancy earlier than the advertised date. This is to ensure our teams can manage application levels while maintaining a positive candidate experience. Once a vacancy has closed, we are unable to consider further applications, so please submit your application as soon as possible to avoid disappointment.

Title: You will be required to develop solutions that ensure that the data and models required are readily available, accessible and meet the quality needed.
Text:
Data Scientist - Scenario Modelling - ESO 
      
     
    
   
   
    
     
      
       Location: Warwick, GB, CV34 6DA 
      
     
    
   
   
    
     
      
       Division: Electricity System Operator 
      
     
    
   
   
    
     
      
       Job Type: 
      
     
    
   
   
    
     
      
       Requisition Number: 46281 
      
     
    
   
   
    
     
      
       Department: ESO 
      
     
    
   
   
    
     
      
       Job Function: Data Analysis and Analytics 
      
     
    
   
   
    
     
      
       
        
         
          About the role
         
         
         
           
          Great Britain's electricity system is undergoing an ambitious, exciting, and vital transformation. Together with industry, we are creating a cleaner, greener system, one that protects the planet and serves generations to come.
           
           
          As the Data Scientist – Scenario Modelling, you will play a crucial role in the Energy Insights & Analysis (EIA) team that leads the ESO’s thinking across the whole energy system covering gas, electricity and hydrogen supply and demand as well as the long-term outlook in relation to the UK’s 2050 net zero emissions target.
           
           
          This includes developing predictive models & future scenarios to provide the analysis on how the energy industry landscape will look in 2050 and work with other teams to provide the narrative on the results to internal and external stakeholders.
           
           
          In this highly analytical role, you will play a key part in developing our ability to model how the energy requirements of tomorrow will evolve and be met. 
          This will involve working closely with other data scientists and analysts within the team to understand their current and future requirements therefore great stakeholder management skills are crucial. You will be required to develop solutions that ensure that the data and models required are readily available, accessible and meet the quality needed.
           
           
          If you have previous scenario, predictive modelling, or forecasting experience in a previous data science or analytical role this might be the perfect fit for you.
           
           
          This Data Scientist role is based at our Warwickoffice which has free onsite parking, and we continue to offer hybrid working from office and home. 
         
        
        
         
           About you
         
         
         
           
          
           Advanced programming skills in Python, Excel, and SQL 
           Experience in building and evaluating predictive models 
           Experience of communicating with, and influencing, internal and external stakeholders 
           Degree in STEM, Statistics, Economics, Data Science, or other relevant Data analytics qualifications or industry experience
          
           
           
          And mostly we would like you:
           
           
          
           Have a keen interest in the UK energy sector and regulatory landscape. 
          
         
        
        
         
          What you'll do
         
         
         
           
          The Data Scientist – Scenario Modelling will have the following enduring key responsibilities:
           
           
          
           Understands the needs of the business and developments needed to meet net zero targets 
           Identifies where existing models or processes need to adapt to reflect these 
           Delivers new and enhanced models to deliver those improvements 
          
         
        
        
         
          What you'll get
         
         
         
           
          A competitive salary of circa £50,000 -70,000 – dependent on capability.
           
           
          As well as your base salary, you will receive a bonus of up to 15% of your salary for stretch performance and a competitive contributory pension scheme where we will double match your contribution to a maximum company contribution of 12%. You will also have access to a number of flexible benefits such as a share incentive plan, salary sacrifice car and technology schemes, support via employee assistance lines and matched charity giving to name a few.
           
           
         
        
        
         
           About us
         
         
         
           
          As Great Britain’s electricity system operator (ESO), we sit at the heart of the electricity system, using our outstanding engineering and commercial expertise to balance electricity supply and demand. Ultimately, we keep the electricity flowing directly to where it’s needed, second by second.
           
           
          Becoming the Energy Future System Operator
           
           
          
          As you may have seen the Government and Ofgem have asked the ESO to take on new roles and responsibilities to help deliver net-zero.
           
          
          Becoming the Energy Future System Operator is a critical step to help deliver a reliable and clean energy transition for all. The ESO, including all of its existing roles, will be at the heart of the new Future System Operator, taking on additional roles with a whole energy system mindset to drive progress towards net zero while maintaining energy security and minimising costs for consumers.
           
          
          The new organisation will be set up as a public corporation with operational independence from government – bringing parties together to support optimised decision making and action. As now, it will be licenced and regulated by Ofgem but funded by consumers through price control agreements. It is anticipated that the new organisation will be up and running by or in 2024.
           
           
          The time to act on climate change is now. As part of our team, you won’t just be touching the lives of almost everyone in Great Britain – you’ll be shaping the way we use and consume energy for generations to come.
           
           
         
        
        
         
           More information
         
         
         
           
          This role closes on August 23rd at 23:59, however we encourage candidates to submit their application as early as possible and not wait until the published closing date as this can vary.
           
          
          We work towards the highest standards in everything we do, including how we support, value and develop our people. Our aim is to encourage and support employees to thrive and be the best they can be. We celebrate the difference people can bring into our organisation, and welcome and encourage applicants with diverse experiences and backgrounds, and offer flexible and tailored support, at home and in the office. 
          We're committed to building a workforce that represents the communities we serve, and a working environment in which each individual feels valued, respected, fairly treated, and able to reach their full potential.
           
           
          #LI-AW2
           
           
          #LI-HYBRID

Title: Line management experience within a data team.
jobsnippet2: Strong communication and data story-telling skills.
Text:
Summary 
 
  
   Salary:
   
  
   Competitive
   
  
   Team:
   
  
   Data Science and Engineering
   
  
   Location:
   
  
   United Kingdom - Hullavington Office
  
 
 


 
  
   We are on an exciting data journey, aiming to transform our business through the Connectivity of our machines, and the MyDyson app.
   
    About the role
    The Data Scientist will be driving insights back into the business to help answer critical questions, and improve the experience our owners get from our app and machines in the future.
   
    You will play an important part in maintaining and improving our Connected Intelligence Platform, Connected Control Tower and Data science toolset to ensure that the answers to crucial questions can either be self-served or provided through modelling and investigation of the data.
   
    The Data Scientist will manage the work of other Data Scientists and Data Analysts, and work closely with our MLOps Engineers to:
   
     Provide leadership and take end-to-end responsibility for data projects
     Contribute original and transformation ideas
   
   
     Create and maintain the capability to provide concise executive-level reporting and be accountable for the quality of analysis provided.
     Instigate and drive the implementation of transformational Data Science projects, including elements of predictive modelling, segmentation, and forecasting.
     Maintain and enhance our Connected Control Tower as business needs evolve.
     Become an expert in our diverse and exciting range of data sources.
     Contribute to the Data Science and Analytics community across the wider business.
   
   
     Ensure that initiatives are validated, tested, and monitored across multiple channels and markets.
     Drive experimentation and A/B testing, including post-campaign analysis
     Impart experience and expertise in providing data-driven solutions to the rest of the team
     Build and maintain relationships with external partners, such as Google, to ensure we fully leverage their toolset and remain at the cutting edge of data technology.
     Contribute to recruitment and help grow a truly global data team
   
   
    About you
   
     SQL (significant experience to an advanced level – BigQuery and/or Redshift an advantage)
     Python in both a Data Science and Software Engineering context
     Experience working with GCP, AWS or other cloud providers.
   
   
     Visualisation (Tableau, Looker)
     Enjoy driving business value and progression against KPIs through data solutions.
     General programming experience
     Proven experience building real-world predictive models within a business
     Strong knowledge and practical experience in statistics, machine learning techniques and data mining methods
   
   
     Recommender systems
     A keen interest in problem solving and finding efficient and scalable solutions to seemingly impossible problems.
     Strong communication and data story-telling skills
     Enjoy presenting findings to project teams & senior stakeholders.
     Ability to prioritise and manage a busy workload, leading on multiple projects simultaneously.
   
   
     Mentors and encourages more junior team members, and enjoys supporting their career progression.
     Collaborates with like-minded Data Scientists to build a network across a large business.
     Line management experience within a data team
   
    Dyson is an equal opportunity employer. We know that great minds don’t think alike, and it takes all kinds of minds to make our technology so unique. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other any other dimension of diversity.

Title: Building of advanced data models to automate decision-making processes.
jobsnippet2: We’ll be asking you to share your experience of applying advanced analysis and modelling…
Text:
Job detailsHere’s how the job details align with your job preferences. Manage job preferences anytime in your profile.Job typeFull-time
 
  Are you an experienced BI and data science analyst with experience of rolling out tech-forward automated solutions? If yes, we’ve got an opportunity for you to join our real estate team here at Starbucks UK on a 6 month fixed term contract. This role will be supporting us to drive forward our technical capabilities to support the business in better understanding performance and identifying opportunities within the UK market. From enhancing our existing reporting set-up through the adoption of advanced statistical models and integration of automated business processes to playing a key role in strategic projects, you’ll get the opportunity to build cross-functional relationships.
 
  
  
 
  To be successful for the role, you’ll have strong analytical skills, backed by sound commercial acumen and be strong, pro-active communicators. With a self-starter mindset, you’ll also have the ability to deal with ambiguity and be motivated by delivering technological transformation at pace. We’ll be asking you to share your experience of applying advanced analysis and modelling techniques to a business context, with knowledge of data technologies and architecture of big data, cloud analytics or AI. It’s essential you have experience with tools such as Tableau or Power BI and have the ability to identify opportunities for data-driven solutions. You’ll ideally have advanced programming languages experience such as Python, R and SQL with experience also in Alteryx Designer and Alteryx Server knowledge, although this isn’t essential.
 
  
  
 
  As our BI and data science analyst, you’ll get involved in: 
  Owning the integrity and accuracy of our data to deliver trusted insights to the rest of the business. 
  Creating innovative solutions using data and research to address wider challenges within Starbucks UK, including enhancing our current set-up of processes and reporting. 
  Taking a big-picture approach in your analysis of business operations, reporting, processes, and decision-making to drive improvements cross-functionally. You’ll be looking at all aspects to understand how our stores perform and what drives that. 
  Working alongside our IT teams and the US BI team to establish and prioritise improvements in our current data management, way of working, and analytics tools. 
  BI report preparation, maintenance, distribution, and automation. 
  Building of advanced data models to automate decision-making processes 
  Engagement with internal partners in order to develop solutions collaboratively which meet the business needs of different functions 
  Taking part in strategic projects across the business, using the data to provide areas of opportunity.
 
 
 

 In return, we’ll offer you a competitive starting salary and benefits that include: 
  
  25 days holiday a year (plus Bank Holidays) 
  Flexible benefits – in addition to the benefits listed here we’ll also provide you with an additional 4% to allow you to select the benefits that suit you 
  Life assurance and private medical insurance for yourself 
  Comprehensive training (including coffee knowledge!) and access to Starbucks Global Academy (our online learning platform to help continuously develop yourself) 
  Free bag of coffee each week and a 30% partner discounts on food, beverages, and merchandise 
  Discounts with local and national retailers (cell phones, gym memberships, entertainment tickets, hotels, etc.) through Perks at Work platform 
  Subscription to Headspace 
  Home Sweet Loan (Interest-free loans that can be paid back over 12 months to help pay your rental deposit) 
  A free 24/7 Employee Assistance Programme available to you and your family
 
  
  So, if you like the thrill of working in a fast-paced environment and creating moments of joy for our customers and partners, apply today! 
  Starbucks is committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce. All applicants and partners will be treated fairly, without regard to race, religion, sex, nationality, age, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity and expression.

Title: The researchers will be expected to carry out research with a high degree of independence at the intersection between computational neuroscience and machine…
Title1: Postdoctoral Research Scientist in Computational Neuroscience and Machine Learning
Text:
Job detailsHere’s how the job details align with your job preferences. Manage job preferences anytime in your profile.Pay£36,024 - £44,263 a yearJob typeFixed term contract
 
  Department of Physiology, Anatomy & Genetics
  
 
  University of Oxford
  
 
  Sherrington Building, Parks Road, Oxford
  
  
 
  Job Title: 
  Postdoctoral Research Scientist in Computational Neuroscience and Machine Learning 
  – 
  Two Posts available
  
  
 
  Salary/Grade: 
  Grade 7. £36,024 - £44,263 per annum
  
  
 
  Fixed Term for 3 years
  
  
 
  We are seeking to appoint two Postdoctoral Research Scientists to join the Neural and Machine Learning Group part of the world-class Oxford Neuroscience and the Oxford Neurotheory initiative. The researchers will be expected to carry out research with a high degree of independence at the intersection between computational neuroscience and machine learning, closely informed by experimental observations.
  
  
 
  The post holders will support the groups’ ongoing efforts to understand how the brain learns efficiently by leveraging deep learning principles and neuroscientific observations. Therefore, you will be working at the frontier of neuroAI, contributing to a new generation of models that will transform our understanding of learning in the brain. You will also build on existing or establish collaborations with experimental or clinical neuroscientists and machine learning researchers at Oxford, the UK and internationally.
  
  
 
  The successful candidates will develop computational models jointly guided by deep learning principles and neuroscientific observations, evaluate the performance of these models functionally as well as by comparing them with various experimental datasets, run computational experiments in Python or another relevant programming language and carry out any other relevant duties as may reasonably be associated with the post and which may be required from time to time.
  
  
 
  The successful candidate will hold a PhD in computational neuroscience and/or machine learning, or a closely related field, experience of research in computational neuroscience or a related field with a strong interest in AI-driven modelling or vice-versa, have expertise in one or more programming languages for scientific computing, such as Python, Julia, MATLAB, or similar and have a publication record appropriate to the stage of career including research publications in peer-reviewed journals and conference proceedings.
  
  
 
  The post is available for immediate start, but the start date is flexible.
  
  
 
  The post will be based in The Centre for Neural Circuits and Behaviour, Tinsley Building. Mansfield Road, Oxford.
  
  
 
  Informal inquiries may be directed to rui.costa@dpag.ox.ac.uk or HR (hr@cncb.ox.ac.uk).
  
  
 
  Closing date for applications is 
  midday on Thursday 31st August 2023
  
  
 
  Interviews are likely to be held the week beginning 11th September 2023
  
  
 
  Applications are particularly welcome from women, black and minority ethnic candidates who are under-represented in academic posts in Oxford.
  
  
 
  We, as a Department and Community, will be considerate and welcoming of all people, regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation and gender identity. We acknowledge societal inequalities and how these impact us, and those around us, personally and professionally. – DPAG Statement of Inclusion. The Neural & Machine Learning Group is also a member of the ALBA network, which advocates for diversity in neuroscience.

Title: Experience in business analytics building big data pipelines, schemas and data sets, within a media data context.
Title1: Marketing Data Science and Infrastructure, Media Lab
jobsnippet2: Experience working with Cloud technologies.
Text:
Minimum qualifications:
  
  Experience in business analytics building big data pipelines, schemas and data sets, within a media data context.  
  Experience using reporting tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker, Power BI) to build business solutions to improve decision making and execution.  
  Experience of data querying languages, statistical programming languages or Machine Learning Models.
 
  
  Preferred qualifications:
  
  Experience in project managing and building data pipelines, schemas and data sets working with both internal and external partners.  
  Experience in root cause analysis to ensure that problems are solved at both a tactical and strategic level.  
  Experience working with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.  
  Experience working with Cloud technologies.  
  Experience with marketing data.  
  Knowledge of statistical concepts, techniques, and methods.  
 
 
  About the job
   
   In this role, you will play a strategic and technical role in driving all things marketing data, with a strong focus on digital marketing data pipelines. You will partner with internal teams to scope, build and deliver strategic initiatives. You will own the end-to-end program management and delivery of key initiatives that support analytics, reporting, modeling and optimization projects.  
  As a Marketing Data Manager, you will be seen as an expert within our team on all things that relate to marketing data, data storage, script writing and dev projects. You will maintain a global scope, and while based out of London, will be supporting global marketing data projects and will act as a bridge across all regions.
   Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems-from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can-changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.
 
 
   Responsibilities
   
   Develop QA processes to ensure that data is checked and validated before release to internal teams, as well as develop detailed delivery plans and communications for key deliverables to keep relevant stakeholders informed.  
   Build and maintain data pipelines, dashboards and business scorecards to help organize data from multiple sources into an easy to digest format that meets functional and business needs.  
   Work with stakeholders to incorporate feedback ensuring that systems, tooling and datasets are usable for defined deliverables. Work with internal and external stakeholders to implement and update processes where necessary, create self-serve capabilities within the team for non-technical users. 
   Work with the Analytics and Data Science teams to create complex datasets where self-service is infeasible, contribute to detailed technical and end-user documentation and training.  
  
 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Title: You will be located in the Department of Computer Science and, in addition to the new centre for Fundamental AI research, you will belong to a large community…
Title1: Lecturer / Senior Lecturer in Machine Learning
Text:
Job detailsHere’s how the job details align with your job preferences. Manage job preferences anytime in your profile.Pay£44,414 - £66,890 a yearJob typePermanent
 
  
   Now is the time to join the University of Manchester when it is significantly boosting its activities in Machine Learning.
    The University of Manchester is making a strategic investment in fundamentals of AI, to complement its existing strengths in AI applications across several prominent research fields in the University, which give high-profile application and collaboration opportunities for the outcomes of fundamental AI research. The university is one of the most active partners of the national Alan Turing Institute, hosts 27 Turing Fellows and Fellows of the European Laboratory of Learning and Intelligent Systems ELLIS, in the new ELLIS Unit Manchester. The university’s ambition is to establish a leading AI centre at the cross section of these opportunities. The university has recently launched a Centre for AI Fundamentals and has already recruited four new academics to it. This lectureship continues this series of positions in establishing the new Centre.
    Applications are welcome in any area of the fundamentals of machine learning, in particular probabilistic modelling, deep learning, reinforcement learning, causal modelling, human-in-the-loop ML, explainable AI, ethics, privacy and security. This position is meant to contribute to machine learning methodologies and not purely to their applications, but note that applications of ML are highly valued within the University. You are expected to be interested in building your career by contributing to the new centre and exploring collaboration opportunities in both methods and applications in the university, in addition to building international networks.
    You will be located in the Department of Computer Science and, in addition to the new centre for Fundamental AI research, you will belong to a large community of machine learning, data science and AI researchers. The university takes pride in its ability to collaborate seamlessly across its departments, schools and faculties. Some of the most useful links include the Alan Turing Institute, ELLIS, the Institute for Data Science and Artificial Intelligence, and the new Christabel Pankhurst Institute for Health Technology.
    As a Manchester staff member, you will be fully supported in application to become a Turing Fellow, with the benefits of facilitated collaboration with other top institutes across the UK. As a member of the Department of Computer Science, you will have access to the outstanding students and interns in both CS and mathematics. You will have a start-up travel budget and given priority for a PhD studentship. As a member of the Centre for Fundamental AI research you will have access to its networks and collaboration. We encourage industry collaboration that is beneficial for research and we are flexible regarding part-time positions with industry.
    The Department of Computer Science is a leading research institution, and values exceptional researchers. You will publish to the highest standards, secure external research funding, pursue real-world impact, and contribute to the PhD training programmes within the Department.
    The Department of Computer Science values exceptional teachers. You will play a key role in maintaining our reputation as an institute of learning – designing and delivering innovative UG/PG topics, both in ML and across the spectrum of Computer Science. Exceptional teachers are encouraged to demonstrate this in their application. Information about the Department of Computer Science can be found at http://www.manchester.ac.uk/cs.
    The University actively fosters a culture of inclusion and diversity and will seek to achieve true equality of opportunity for all members of its community. The Department was awarded an Athena Swan Bronze award in 2017 and strongly encourages applications from all sections of the community.
    For international applicants: A Senior Lecturer position corresponds to US associate professors with the same expectations, except that in the UK they are permanent or tenured from the start, subject to probation.

Title: This is a post-doctoral research role to contribute to and develop the research work on the project “Tracking food quality at the bottom of marine food webs…
Title1: PDRA in Marine Remote Sensing and Machine Learning
Text:
This is a post-doctoral research role to contribute to and develop the research work on the project “Tracking food quality at the bottom of marine food webs using machine learning and satellite remote-sensing”. Crucial for marine-resource conservation, environmental protection, food security and sustainable development of the ocean is to advance our capability for operationally monitoring novel ecological changes in the marine environments. 
 The PDRA will be based at the Department of Geography and Environmental Science, University of Reading (UoR), UK. The University of Reading is one of the UK’s leading research-intensive universities and, based on research power, is one of the top three UK universities for Earth Systems and Environmental Science (ESES). The UoR has strong involvement in the NERC National Centre for Earth Observation (NCEO) and the project will benefit from the remote sensing and modelling experts at the NCEO.
  The PDRA will have:
 
   A PhD (or soon to obtain PhD) in relevant subject or discipline (e.g. but not limited to Machine Learning, Satellite remote sensing, Data Science, Environmental Science, Marine Ecosystems)
   Excellent computer skills e.g. coding in R/Python/MATLAB or similar
   Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
   Good understanding of satellite remote sensing and marine ecosystems
   Record of publishing high-quality peer-reviewed papers
   Strong motivation to work with multidisciplinary team
 
  For the full information on the job role, please see the attached job description and person specification. 
  Tentative Interviews date: 07/09/2023

Title: Each clinical study is set-up according to the clinical protocol which details the study design, objectives, dosing information, data collection and reporting…
Text:
Job detailsHere’s how the job details align with your job preferences. Manage job preferences anytime in your profile.Job typePermanent
 Company Overview 
 Quotient Sciences is a drug development and manufacturing accelerator providing integrated programs and tailored services across the entire development pathway. Cutting through silos across a range of drug development capabilities, we help biotech and pharma customers save precious time and money in getting drugs to patients. 
 As a growing and successful business, we employ more than 1,300 talented individuals globally, located at state-of-the-art development, manufacturing,clinical and Data Science facilities in the UK and USA. 
 Science, Agility and Culture are the core components that define Quotient Sciences, enabling us to do what we do in the way that we do it. People join Quotient Sciences because we are a respected member of the drug development community, driven by an unswerving belief that ideas need to become solutions, and molecules need to become cures, fast. Because humanity needs solutions, fast. 
 The Role 
 Quotient Sciences has a fantastic career opportunity for a Trainee Statistical Programmer. This role will be based in the Statistical Programming department at our site in Edinburgh. 
 This is an excellent opportunity to start your career as a Trainee Statistical Programmer and be involved in the challenging environment of early phase clinical studies. You will be trained in many different aspects of statistical programming and work with complex clinical data. 
 Data Sciences at Quotient Sciences comprises over 100 staff and provides an expert service in the data management, modelling, analysis and reporting of early Phase clinical studies (both healthy volunteer and patient). 
 Each clinical study is set-up according to the clinical protocol which details the study design, objectives, dosing information, data collection and reporting methods. Other project team members will perform tasks such as study database set-up, collection of data, perform formal statistical analysis, report writing, etc. 
 Working as part of the team your role as a programming specialist will involve the following: 
 
  To program tables, listings, figures and study datasets 
  We use the programming language SAS (an industry standard, widely used outside the clinical sector too) and full training will be provided in the SAS programming language and programming techniques 
  Dependent on your development, our career pathway allows you to expand your programming role over time and progress to more senior roles and tasks 
  Early Phase studies present particular SAS programming challenges due to their complexity (e.g. due to multiple study parts) and mid-study protocol/database changes, interim reporting/transfers, etc. 
  You will be expected to be flexible and creative in your programming skills 
  
 The Candidate 
 The successful candidate will have a life science or numerate degree and have experience of using a programming language, ideally SAS or R. You will have an understanding of programming concepts and a strong interest in developing a career as a Statistical Programmer working with clinical data and standards. Previous clinical industry experience of SAS, or/ and knowledge of ICH GCP and clinical trials would be an advantage. 
 Candidates with previous clinical industry experience will be considered for a more senior role. 
 Other skills and experience required: 
 
  Good organisational and presentation skills and be able to work to deadlines whilst maintaining quality standards 
  Good attention to detail and the ability to multitask 
  Effective oral and written communication skills are also required as you will, in time, be a primary statistical programming point of contact with clients, external data providers and clinical staff. 
  
 Applicants must have the right to work in the UK upon being offered employed. 
 Company Benefits 
 In return you will receive a competitive salary, a generous benefits package, excellent training and development, as well as an exciting career within a fast paced and dynamic business. 
 Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion 
 Quotient Sciences are advocates for positive change and conscious inclusion. We strive to create a diverse Quotient family and develop a workplace culture that provides a sense of acceptance for every person within our organisation. As a global employer, we recognise the value in having an organisation that is a true reflection and representation of our society today. All applicants are welcome.

Title: All will be full-time permanent positions.

Text:
Job detailsHere’s how the job details align with your job preferences. Manage job preferences anytime in your profile.Job typeFull-timePermanentWork SettingsDisability confident
 Faculty of Environment, Science & Economy
  
  
  Following a significant investment, we are seeking to appoint a number of academics interested in researching and/or teaching Artificial Intelligence (AI), Maths of AI, Machine Learning, Data Science and their applications. The new academics will come with a range of experience and expertise and we will seek to build a strong and diverse team of individuals able to achieve great things together and with colleagues in other fields within and outside the university.
  
  
  These appointments are a unique opportunity to join the University of Exeter and contribute to the development and delivery of an ambitious research, education agenda using the power of data science and AI for the benefit of society.
  
  
  All will be full-time permanent positions.
  
  
  We are looking to appoint from Lecturer up to Professor across E&R (research focused) and E&S (teaching focused), for the following areas: 
  
  AI and Health 
  Computer Vision 
  Environmental Intelligence 
  Maths of AI 
  Software Engineering 
  Machine Learning 
  Data Science
 
  
  
  For more information on this campaign and to find job descriptions for these roles, please have a look at our online brochure: https://digital.exeter.ac.uk/computer-science-candidate-pack/
  
  
  We seek to support the research stars of now and the future, and welcome applications from candidates holding or seeking to hold research fellowships with a transition to full-time Lecturer once the fellowship ends.
  
  
  Please ensure you read the job description and person specification, which can be found in the online candidate pack.
  
  
  Please state in your application which role you are applying too. 
  
 If you are interested in these positions, we recommend that you apply as soon as possible. This is a rolling-recruitment campaign and applications will be reviewed on a regular basis and interviews will be held throughout the recruitment period. We will be reviewing applications the first working day of each month throughout September - December.
  
  
  What we can offer you: 
  
  Freedom (and the support) to pursue your intellectual interests and to work creatively across disciplines; 
  Support teams that understand the University wide teaching goals and partner with our academics accordingly; 
  An Innovation, Impact and Business directorate that works closely with our academics providing specialist support for external engagement and development; 
  Our Exeter Academic initiative supports high performing academics to achieve their potential and develop their career; 
  A multitude of staff benefits including sector leading benefits around maternity, adoption and shared parental leave(up to 26 weeks full pay), Paternity leave (up to 6 weeks full pay), and a Fertility Treatment Policy; 
  A beautiful campus set in the heart of stunning Devon.
 
  
  
  The University of Exeter 
 We are a member of the prestigious Russell Group of research-intensive universities and in the top 150 universities in the world (Times Higher Education World University Rankings 2023 and the 2022 Academic Ranking of World Universities released by Shanghai Rankings).
  
  
  Our research income in recent years means we’re the fastest growing UK Research University with some of the world’s most influential scientists, and we seek to answer some of the most fundamental issues facing humankind today. More than 99% of our research is of international quality and our world-leading research impact is growing faster than any other Russell Group university (2021 Research Excellence Framework). We are using the power of our education and research to create a sustainable, healthy and socially just future. Our shared purpose and vision continually moves us forward to make a difference to our people, our communities, our partners and the world around us. Read about our world leading research on Green Futures and how we are transforming education for a changing world. We are located in a beautiful part of the country and Exeter (a fast growing tech hub) is one of only a few UK cities to have been designated as a UNESCO City of Literature
  
  
  Our Equality, Diversity and Inclusion Commitment 
  Whilst all applicants will be judged on merit alone, we particularly welcome applications from groups currently underrepresented within our working community. Reasonable adjustments are available for interviews and workplaces.
  
  
  With over 30,000 students and 7,000 staff from 150 different countries we offer a diverse and engaging environment where our diversity is celebrated and valued as a major strength. We are committed to creating an inclusive culture where all members of our community are supported to thrive; where diverse voices are heard through our engagement with evidence-based charter frameworks for gender (Athena SWAN and Project Juno for Physics), race equality (Race Equality Charter Mark), LGBTQ+ inclusion (Stonewall Diversity Champion) and as a Disability Confident employer.
  
  
  Further Information 
  Please see individual job descriptions for who best to contact, or email Prof Nick Stone at N.Stone@exeter.ac.uk.

Title: Applications are welcome from candidates working in any area of mathematics for environmental data science, including data assimilation and deep learning.
Title1: Lecturer in Mathematics of Environmental Data Science
Text:
Job detailsHere’s how the job details align with your job preferences. Manage job preferences anytime in your profile.Pay£45,585 - £56,021 a yearJob typeFull-time
 We are seeking to appoint a candidate with an excellent research record to a permanent Lectureship in the Mathematics of Environmental Data Science (equivalent to North American assistant professorship). Applications are welcome from candidates working in any area of mathematics for environmental data science, including data assimilation and deep learning. The post is a joint position between the Department of Mathematics and Statistics and the Department of Meteorology at the University of Reading. It is a full-time position, but flexible working arrangements can be considered. 
 
  You will have:
   
  
   A PhD in Mathematics or in a quantitative science, or equivalent research experience;
   An excellent track record of research in an area related to the mathematics of environmental data science, evidenced by publications of international standing;
   Ability to teach across a range of modules and levels in mathematics;
   Dedication to high-quality teaching and learning.
  
 
  The Department of Mathematics and Statistics offers students a vibrant teaching and learning environment coupled with world-leading research in applied and numerical mathematics, pure mathematics and statistics. The Department of Meteorology is a thriving community of over 200 academics and research scientists and more than 150 students. It also hosts some staff of the UK Met Office, the NERC National Centre for Atmospheric Sciences (NCAS) and the NERC National Centre for Earth Observation (NCEO). Along with the Department of Computer Science, the two departments form part of the School of Mathematical, Physical and Computational Sciences. A core part of the School is the Data Assimilation Research Centre (DARC), involving 8 academic staff and around 20 research staff and students crossing the different departments. DARC has a strong research record in data assimilation theory and applications, collaborating with scientists in operational centres such as the Met Office and ECMWF, as well as with NCEO and other academic groups. The co-directors of DARC are Prof Sarah Dance and Prof Amos Lawless, who are also co-directors of the Data Assimilation Division of NCEO.
 
  For further details about the research environment see
  Department of Mathematics and Statistics https://www.reading.ac.uk/maths-and-stats/

  National Centre for Earth Observation https://www.nceo.ac.uk/
  Advancing the Frontiers of Earth System Prediction research programme https://research.reading.ac.uk/earth-system-prediction/

Title: You will join a team of probabilistic modellers and machine learning researchers developing new collaborative AI principles and methods.
Title1: Research Associate in Machine Learning (2 Posts Available)
Text:
Job detailsHere’s how the job details align with your job preferences. Manage job preferences anytime in your profile.Pay£37,099 - £44,263 a yearJob typeFixed term contractWork SettingsDisability confident
 Applicants are invited for the post of Research Associate in probabilistic machine learning.
  You will join a team of probabilistic modellers and machine learning researchers developing new collaborative AI principles and methods. This is an exciting topic which inspires new problems in fundamental ML work, and allows attacking new applications which make a difference, for instance in scientific research. Different team members have different expertise, and by working together are able to address more novel problems. Keywords include: automatic experimental design, Bayesian inference, human-in-the-loop learning, machine teaching, privacy-preserving learning, reinforcement learning, inverse reinforcement learning, computational rationality and user modelling, and simulator-based inference. Initial applications will include decision making in personalized medicine, steering experimental design in drug design and synthetic biology, and design of digital twins and decision making with them. Prior experience on the application domains is a plus but not required.
  The team is funded by an UKRI Turing AI World-Leading Fellowship and hosted in the recently established Centre for AI Fundamentals, which is cross-Faculty initiative with significant internal investment, forming a core of an ambitious plan to establish Manchester as an internationally leading centre for AI research and innovation.
  You will have excellent opportunities for working with top-notch collaborators on use cases in application fields in the University of Manchester, machine learning collaborators at the Turing Institute and ELLIS, and with industry in both the centre and the newly established Manchester Turing Innovation Hub.
  The University actively fosters a culture of inclusion and diversity and seeks to achieve true equality of opportunity for all members of its community. The Faculty welcomes applications from all sections of the community and are committed to having a representative workforce. Across our Schools/Departments, we hold Bronze and Silver Athena SWAN Awards, which recognise our commitment to equality, diversity, inclusion and access and particularly the advancement of women’s careers in STEM. 
 The University also holds a Bronze Race Charter Mark recognising our commitment to improving the representation, progression and success of minority ethnic staff and students within higher education. In addition, we are a Disability Confident Employer, guaranteeing an interview for any disabled applicant who meets the essential criteria for a job. 
 What you will get in return:
 
   Fantastic market leading Pension scheme
   Excellent employee health and wellbeing services including an Employee Assistance Programme
   Exceptional starting annual leave entitlement, plus bank holidays

   Local and national discounts at a range of major retailers

Title: Knowledge of data warehousing and dimensional modelling.
jobsnippet2: Familiarity with data security and privacy standards and best practices.
Text:
️Title: Data Scientist
  Location: UK or Europe, Hybrid Remote
  Department: Data
 
  About Tech Alchemy
  Tech Alchemy builds some of the most exciting startups in the world. In the past year we have built products featured by Apple, Amazon and BBC. We have helped raise over £75 million and exited twice. We’re a group of developers, designers and data scientists accelerating hand picked startups. Our services cover multiple parallels including concept design, branding, software development, business analysis, and funding.
  We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join our Data Team!
  The Opportunity
  We are seeking an experienced Data Scientist focused on analytics. You will be responsible for dissecting internal data, analyzing user interactions, and collaborating closely with product owners to develop and refine product specifications. Your insights and analysis will be pivotal in optimizing strategies, enabling informed decision-making, and maximizing user engagement with our crypto-specific products.
  Responsibilities
  Data Analysis, Strategy and Interpretation:
  
   Extract, clean, and process large datasets from various sources, including user interactions, transactions, and other relevant data points related to various blockchain and crypto products. 
  Conduct thorough data analysis to drive meaningful insights and actionable recommendations to improve product performance and user experience. 
  Identify key factors influencing user behavior before presales and investments in crypto products. 
  Analyze user engagement patterns and provide strategic recommendations to optimize presale strategies for increased conversions and customer satisfaction. 
 
  Product Collaboration:
 
   Collaborate with product owners and cross-functional teams to understand product requirements and assist in defining detailed product specifications that align with data-driven insights.
 
  Data Visualization, Reporting and Decision Making:
  
  
   Create visually compelling dashboards and reports to communicate complex data findings to stakeholders, ensuring the insights are accessible and actionable. 
  Design and execute A/B tests and experimentation to evaluate the impact of product changes on user behavior and product performance. 
  Work closely with the leadership team to provide data-driven insights and recommendations to drive business growth and profitability.
 
 
  What will you bring to Tech Alchemy?
  
   Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field. 
  Proven experience as a Data Scientist, Data Engineer, or similar role with a focus on analytics and insights 
  Knowledge within blockchain technology, crypto or web3 would be beneficial. 
  Strong proficiency in SQL, NoSQL, MongoDB, Postgres and big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, AWS Glue). 
  Experience with real-time data processing and streaming technologies (e.g., Kafka, Kinesis, or Pub/Sub). 
  Experience with Python and Tableau 
  Knowledge of data warehousing and dimensional modelling. 
  Familiarity with data security and privacy standards and best practices
 
 
  What will you get from us? 
 Flexible Working: Our HQ is in Shoreditch, but we promote remote working
  Company Issued Tech: You’ll receive a bunch of tech ahead of your first day
  ️Health and Wellbeing: Comprehensive private health benefits 
 Holiday: 25 days + bank holidays and your birthday off
  ️️Weekly Lunch Allowance: Have a free lunch on us
  Work-life Balance: Team members have the freedom and flexibility to organise their own work schedules with a high degree of autonomy in your role
